meanings.definition: A person or company that provides indemnity or compensation for loss or damage.
meanings.sent1: The insurance company acted as indemnifiers for the car accident.
meanings.sent2: We rely on indemnifiers to protect us from financial harm in case of emergencies.
meanings.sent3: The indemnifiers were like superheroes swooping in to save the day after the flood.
meanings.sent4: Her friends were her emotional indemnifiers, always there to support and comfort her.
meanings.sent5: The indemnifiers were like a safety net, ensuring we could bounce back from any setback.

meanings.definition: Something that serves as a guarantee against loss or damage.
meanings.sent1: The warranty on the product acted as an indemnifier for any defects.
meanings.sent2: Having savings is a good indemnifier against unexpected expenses.
meanings.sent3: The lucky charm was his personal indemnifier against bad luck.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the best indemnifier against a gloomy day.
meanings.sent5: The strong foundation of the house was the ultimate indemnifier against earthquakes.
